com.github.gwtd3.api

Class Colors

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.gwtd3.api.Colors

  • public class Colors
extends Object
    Provides factory methods to create colors.

    Author:
    Anthony Schiochet

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Colors()

      Constructs a new HSL color with the specified hue h, saturation s and lightness l.

      Constructs a new HSL color from an existing color object.

      static RGBColor rgb(Color color)
      Construct a new RGB color from the existing color object.

      Constructs a new RGB color with the specified r, g and b channel values.

    • Method Detail

      • rgb

        public static final RGBColor rgb(int r,
           int g,
           int b)
        Constructs a new RGB color with the specified r, g and b channel values. Each channel must be specified as an integer in the range [0,255]. The channels are available as the r, g and b attributes of the returned object.
        Parameters:
        r - the red channel
        g - the green channel
        b - the blue channel
        Returns:
        the new color instance

      • rgb

        public static final RGBColor rgb(String color)
        Constructs a new RGB color by parsing the specified color string. The color string may be in a variety of formats:
        • rgb decimal - "rgb(255,255,255)"
        • hsl decimal - "hsl(120,50%,20%)"
        • rgb hexadecimal - "#ffeeaa"
        • rgb shorthand hexadecimal - "#fea"
        • named - "red", "white", "blue"
        Parameters:
        color - the color string representation
        Returns:
        the new color

      • rgb

        public static final RGBColor rgb(Color color)
        Construct a new RGB color from the existing color object.

        Parameters:
        color - the existing color object
        Returns:
        the new color

      • hsl

        public static final HSLColor hsl(int h,
           double s,
           double l)
        Constructs a new HSL color with the specified hue h, saturation s and lightness l. The hue must be a number in the range [0,360]. The saturation and lightness must be in the range 0,1. These values are available as the h, s and l attributes of the returned object.
        Parameters:
        h - the hue channel [0;360]
        s - the saturation channel [0;1]
        l - the light channel [0;1]
        Returns:
        the new color instance

      • hsl

        public static final HSLColor hsl(String color)
        Constructs a new HSL color by parsing the specified color string. The color string may be in a variety of formats:
        • rgb decimal - "rgb(255,255,255)"
        • hsl decimal - "hsl(120,50%,20%)"
        • rgb hexadecimal - "#ffeeaa"
        • rgb shorthand hexadecimal - "#fea"
        • named - "red", "white", "blue"
        Parameters:
        color - the color string representation
        Returns:
        the new color

      • hsl

        public static final HSLColor hsl(RGBColor color)
        Constructs a new HSL color from an existing color object.

        Parameters:
        color - the existing color object
        Returns:
        the new color
